bibl.title: Draft of letter from [Philip Showalter Hench] to Pedro Nogueira, April 15, 1948

div1.p: [Hench] discusses the funding approved, by the Minister of Public Works, for the Camp Lazear memorial. [Hench] describes his meetings, arranged by Carbonell, with the Cuban Vice-President and engineer Colete, and postulates that Colete and the Vice-President may have influenced the approval of the funds.

div1.head: Draft of letter from [Philip Showalter Hench] to Pedro Nogueira, April 15, 1948

4/15/48
My dear Dr Nogueira
div1.p:
On my return to Rochester I found a mass of work waiting
for me and I have had a hard time getting caught up. I have
the most satisfactory memories of my trip to Havana and I
am most grateful to you for your wonderful help.

I have just received from you through Mr. Moran the
fine collection of photographs. I am delighted to have them.
Thank you so much. I have also just received the new
air views (the 5 perpendicular views comprising the
air-panel or air-map, and the two new tangential
FINE
also views of Camp Lazear). They are fine and much better
than the first ones they took. I I was disturbed disturbed
When I received the first set I was disturbed to note that
in the perpendicular shot Views the Caseta was just off
the edge & not in the photograph; also the tangential
views were taken somewhat too far from the Caseta. This
was undoubtedly my fault as the rough pencilled circle
I had drawn hastily on my little map for Colonel
Chavez took in too much territory south of the Caseta.
But the second ones are fine and I am delighted with
them. I have written a note sent a telegram & written a
note of thanks to Col Chavez. Without his and your help
I would not have been able to get these. They will be most
useful.

I was delighted indeed to have a telegram from
Dr Carbonell and Mr. Honorato Colete that the
Minister of Public Works had affirmed a sum of
$50,000 toward the preservation of the caseta. I telegraphed
them my sincere appreciation. I think I told you that
Dr Carbonell who had come to see me the just right I was
in Havana & who Having read one of my articles on the
Conquest of Yellow Fever he, had become interested in my project.
During most of my visit he was busy with this and that
including a day or two entertaining the King & Queen
of the Belgians. so I didnt see much of him until about
(2
2 or 3 days before our departure when he suddenly took Mrs.
Hench & me to meet the Vice-President one night about 11 oclock.
The Vice President expressed much interest in our Project
and said he would speak about it to the President and also
k the Minister of Public Works. The next day Dr Carbonell
took me to the Ministry but the Minister was busy with
politics. However we met the Minister's Secretary who
Dr Carbonell introduced me to Mr Colete, an official
in the Ministry. He took us to meet the Ministers Secretary
and I went over the project. He seemed much interested
and wanted me to meet the Minister in 2 days. But this
was way the day before I left Havana & I couldn't stay
longer.

I do not know exactly what happened. You
probably do. Apparently Mr Colete did see the Minister.
I dont know whether the President or Vice President
had anything to do with it; possibly they did. In any
event Im delighted to hear that the $50,000 was
assigned to the project,

Do you think the work will really be started soon
or do you think there may still be delays? What
will happen if the work isnt started before the
gran regime administration closes? Will we have to
start all over again? I do hope not. If you can
tell me anything about this I will greatly appreciate
it. I had a short note about this for Mr Moran
but he hadnt heard much yet. Insert p 2b

Since my return I have been going over my
material and am sending you herewithno, no not
only copies of the photographs we took together,
but some photographs and other items I have
which I hope will interest you.

Director of the Sanitary Unit of Marianao
Dr Noguiera, since you are (I understand) Public Health
officer for Quemados and Marianao

In order to be helpful I have sent to the Minister of Public Works a formal letter outlining
my plans for the memorializing & preservation of Camp
Lazear. I enclose a carbon copy of that letter with the rough sketches of my ideas Please
read it carefully & give me your own ideas. I
It would be fine if you could discuss this letter with
Mr. Luis Danval, Director of Architecture of the
Ministry of Public Works. And since you are
Director of the Sanitary Unit of Marianao you
will undoubtedly have may ideas as to just
what kind of an additional sanitary unit
it would be most useful to erect on Camp Lazear
as part of the Cuban-American memorial.

p.del:
I hope you received my recent letter in which I asked
if you had your own copy of Dr Howard Kelly's book
on Walter Reed and Yellow Fever, just published about
1905.; also do you have a copy of the U. S Senate
Document 822 on yellow fever? This is an important &
rare document which contains most of the papers of the
U. S. Board. If you don't have these rare books I want
to send them to you with my sincere appreciation of all
you did for me.

div1.p:
Have you heard any more from Dr Presno about the
Finlay diary? I am so anxious to have them
microfilmed completely so that you & I can both have
copies and, more important, so that the data will
not be lost in case the original notebooks are lost,
stolen or destroyed by fire or other means. I think
it is very important for American physicians to
know much more, as much as possible about Dr
Finlay & it is my hope that I can help to accomplish
this (as the Cubans should know more about Reed
& his colleagues).

If you have not been able to persuade Dr Presno
to let you bring them along next month, I will ask
the Curator or Chief Librarian of the Surgeon
General's Filiaz or of the national archives in
Washington to make an official & formal request
to the Academy of Sciences of Havana, through
Dr Presno, to lend them for micro-filming.
In this way Dr Presno & his associates in the
